entries.text: If a tie remains after applying this hierarchy, the matter must be escalated to the Classification Panel for documented resolution.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: The governance framework of New Doggerland is intentionally designed to be fully operational prior to organizational scale or reputational maturity. This sequencing reflects the principle that safety, accountability, and control must precede growth rather than follow it.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Future decisions regarding expansion, funding structure, or operational tempo shall be evaluated against this principle, with preference given to preserving governance integrity over accelerating outcomes.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Mistakes are expected. Bad-faith actions, concealment, or retaliation are prohibited. Errors addressed transparently must not be punished solely for occurrence.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text:
• Long-Horizon Duty: No short-term gains over long-term stewardship
• Non-Extractive Principle: No structure may extract value from land, animals, or people
• Maintenance Obligation: No adoption of assets that can’t be reasonably maintained
• Durability Preference: Favor repairable and durable options
• Stewardship Over Optimization: Cost or growth cannot override core duties
• Adaptive Compliance: Methods may change, but harms may not be allowed

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: ## Classification, Arbitration, and Accountability

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: All material actions must be classified as Mistake, Violation, or Abuse.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Good faith + reasonable belief + prompt disclosure + non-recurrence = Mistake.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Intentional bypass, concealment, reckless disregard, or persistence after correction = Violation.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Meets Violation criteria + exploit intent, retaliation, repetition, or credible harm.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Requires escalation and may trigger authority removal.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: A three-member panel is required. No person may classify their own conduct.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: If the organization's staff count is fewer than three (3) persons, or if the Stewardship role is vacant, the affected selection slot defaults to an external appointee selected by the appointing body from among persons who satisfy the independence requirements of an External Governance Arbiter (as defined in Section~), excluding current Governing Body members, the Founder, and the Founder Steward.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: This minimal-scale provision does not expand panel authority and terminates automatically when the staffing or vacancy condition is resolved.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: If values materially relate to harm, the panel must assess whether they were ignored.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Only logs, facts, and credible testimony may be considered.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text:
• Mistake = Preponderance
• Violation = Clear evidence
• Abuse = Clear and convincing

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: If the threshold is not met, classification defaults to the lowest applicable level.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Testimony must be first-hand, internally consistent, and corroborated.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Uncorroborated testimony alone cannot support an Abuse finding.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Each classified party may appeal once to a pre-approved External Governance Arbiter (as defined in Section~).

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text:
Panelists serve staggered 24-month terms, max two consecutive terms. 
Expired panelists are automatically disqualified.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Quorum loss pauses classification and prohibits irreversible decisions.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text:
• Must include at least 1/3 external origin
• No single source can control majority
• Published with source and conflict info
• Governance may remove for cause, but not unilaterally replace
• Replacements must originate from the same category

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Where this document requires an External Governance Arbiter, the Arbiter must be assigned by a documented random selection process from the eligible Arbiter pool, unless random selection is infeasible due to conflicts, unavailability, or time-critical constraints.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: If random selection is infeasible, the appointing body must document:

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text:
• the specific infeasibility reason,
• the conflicts screened,
• the selection method used, and
• why the selected Arbiter best preserves independence under Section~.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: If the Governing Body fails to rotate panelists, the Steward’s Office (as defined in Section~) appoints a temporary interim member strictly for continuity purposes and not eligible for a full term.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: When emergency authority is invoked to prevent imminent harm, subsequent review must begin with a presumption of good faith unless evidence indicates concealment, reckless disregard, or exploit intent.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: This presumption does not prevent review, classification, or consequence, but it prohibits adverse classification based solely on frequency, urgency, or outcome absent supporting evidence.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Repeated emergency invocations by the same actor within a rolling review period automatically trigger a mandatory comparative analysis and panel review. Frequency alone must not determine classification, but it must require the panel to assess patterns, decision-pathway quality, and scope compliance.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Repeated, independently logged actions that align in time, method, or target may be treated as corroborative evidence even if no single incident independently meets the Abuse threshold.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Patterns may corroborate intent, recklessness, or concealment when:

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text:
• actions recur under substantially similar circumstances
• affected parties or targets overlap
• logs, timing, or decision pathways show consistent deviation

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Pattern-based corroboration must not rely on subjective impressions alone and must be grounded in recorded facts.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Any intentional alteration, suppression, destruction, or fabrication of logs, records, or audit trails constitutes prima facie evidence of Violation.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: If tampering materially impairs classification, the presumption escalates to Abuse unless the actor demonstrates a credible, non-exploitative cause.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Good-faith errors that are promptly disclosed and corrected do not constitute tampering.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Emergency log stubs must be written to an append-only, tamper-evident record system meeting policy-defined integrity requirements. Deletion or modification must be detectably evident upon review.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: ### Residence Protection Disqualification Upon Abuse

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Any finding of Abuse under this Section automatically terminates all residence protections granted under Section~ for the offending individual.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text:
• is mandatory and non-discretionary
• applies regardless of tenure, role, or relationship
• does not require a separate vote or process
• takes effect upon final classification or exhaustion of appeal

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: This disqualification does not affect the rights of non-offending parties unless independently implicated by classification.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: ### Whistleblower Protection and Anti-Retaliation Presumption

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Any adverse action taken against a person for reporting, cooperating with, or reasonably attempting to report a concern in good faith constitutes presumptive Abuse.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text:
• termination, demotion, or discipline
• intimidation, threats, or coercion
• housing displacement or access restriction
• isolation, role stripping, or reputational harm

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: The presumption of Abuse applies unless the actor demonstrates by clear evidence that the action was:

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text:
• unrelated to the report or cooperation
• proportionate
• independently justified

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Good-faith but mistaken reports do not constitute misconduct and must not trigger adverse action.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: This protocol exists solely to prevent unavoidable harm caused by continued enforcement of an Unchangeable provision under materially changed conditions.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: This protocol must not be used to optimize convenience, efficiency, growth, or authority.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: The Constitutional Repair Protocol may be invoked only if all of the following conditions are met:

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text:
• continued enforcement of a specific Unchangeable provision would cause substantial and demonstrable harm
• the harm cannot be mitigated through interpretation, operational adjustment, or use of emergency authority
• the harm arises from material changes in factual or legal conditions not reasonably foreseeable at the time of adoption

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text:
• a supermajority vote of not less than eighty percent of the full Governing Body
• written findings specifying the exact provision at issue, the harm caused, and why no lesser remedy is sufficient
• unanimous approval by a pre-approved External Governance Arbiter panel composed solely of eligible Arbiters as defined in Section~

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text:
• be limited strictly to the minimum change necessary to remove the identified harm
• preserve all other Unchangeable provisions without alteration
• create no new powers, rights, or entitlements beyond what is required to eliminate the harm

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: If the Trigger Threshold in this Protocol is met but the Delay and Disclosure period has not yet elapsed, the Governing Body may authorize a strictly temporary Interim Mitigation solely to prevent the specific harm identified in the written findings.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text:
• does not amend, suspend, or waive any Unchangeable provision
• is permitted only to reduce the identified harm pending the effective date of an approved Repair
• must be the minimum operational deviation necessary to prevent harm
• must be time-limited to not more than thirty (30) days per authorization
• must be renewed only by the same vote threshold required for Invocation Requirements under this Protocol
• must be reversible where practicable
• must be logged as a Material Action with an explicit INTERIM-MITIGATION reason code and citation to the specific Repair findings

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text:
• create new powers, entitlements, compensation rights, housing rights, or governance authority
• authorize asset disposition, land use changes, policy modification, or any action prohibited under Continuity Authority

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: All Interim Mitigation authorizations and renewals must be included in the public disclosure materials for the Repair.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Approved modifications must be subject to a mandatory public disclosure and delay period of not less than sixty days prior to effect.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: The disclosure must include the full text of the proposed change, the recorded votes, and the written findings.

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text: Within twelve months of any repair taking effect, the Governing Body must commission an independent review assessing:

entries.label: Consolidated Governance Document
entries.text:
• whether the repair successfully eliminated the identified harm
• whether unintended consequences occurred
• whether the repair can be narrowed or reversed

entries.label: Schedule A — Material Action Thresholds
entries.text: This Schedule defines concrete thresholds and classifications that operationalize the definition of Material Action in the Consolidated Governance Document. Where thresholds are met or exceeded, the action is conclusively material and must follow all Material Action requirements.

entries.label: Schedule A — Material Action Thresholds
entries.text: An action is a Material Action if it meets or exceeds any threshold in this Schedule, regardless of intent, reversibility, or duration.

entries.label: Schedule A — Material Action Thresholds
entries.text: Failure to meet a threshold does not guarantee that an action is non-material; judgment must still be applied using the definition in the Consolidated Governance Document.

entries.label: Schedule A — Material Action Thresholds
entries.text: Any single commitment, expenditure, reimbursement, or obligation meeting or exceeding the following thresholds is a Material Action:

entries.label: Schedule A — Material Action Thresholds
entries.text:
• \$2,500 for equipment, tools, furnishings, or supplies
• \$1,000 for professional services, consulting, or advisory services
• \$500 for travel, lodging, or discretionary expenses per individual per event

entries.label: Schedule A — Material Action Thresholds
entries.text: Multiple related expenditures must be aggregated when they are part of the same project, purpose, vendor relationship, or temporal window.

entries.label: Schedule A — Material Action Thresholds
entries.text:
• \$5,000 within any rolling 30-day period, or
• \$10,000 within any rolling 12-month period

entries.label: Schedule A — Material Action Thresholds
entries.text: Any contract, lease, service agreement, or subscription that:

entries.label: Schedule A — Material Action Thresholds
entries.text:
• exceeds six (6) months in duration, or
• creates automatic renewal, or
• cannot be terminated without penalty

entries.label: Schedule A — Material Action Thresholds
entries.text:
• creation or elimination of a paid role
• any compensation adjustment exceeding ten percent (10\
• provision of housing, stipends, or non-cash benefits outside standard payroll
• any compensation or benefit involving the Founder or a related party

entries.label: Schedule A — Material Action Thresholds
entries.text:
• acquisition, sale, lease, or encumbrance of land
• acquisition or disposal of assets valued above \$5,000
• granting of easements, access rights, or long-term use rights

entries.label: Schedule A — Material Action Thresholds
entries.text:
• creation, modification, or revocation of delegated approval authority
• granting bank access, signing authority, or system administrator rights
• creation of any role with independent spending or contracting authority

entries.label: Schedule A — Material Action Thresholds
entries.text:
• Emergency Authority

entries.label: Schedule A — Material Action Thresholds
entries.text:

entries.label: Schedule C — Delegation & Approval Matrix
entries.text: This Schedule defines the exclusive delegation and approval limits for financial, contractual, operational, and emergency-related actions within New Doggerland.

entries.label: Schedule C — Delegation & Approval Matrix
entries.text: No person or role may approve, authorize, or commit the organization beyond the limits explicitly stated in this Schedule.

entries.label: Schedule C — Delegation & Approval Matrix
entries.text: Silence in this Schedule does not confer authority.

entries.label: Schedule C — Delegation & Approval Matrix
entries.text: All delegation under this Schedule is subject to the following constraints:

entries.label: Schedule C — Delegation & Approval Matrix
entries.text:
• Delegation defines who may approve, not what is permissible.
• All actions remain subject to Mission Lock, welfare, dignity, and safety constraints.
• Any action exceeding these limits constitutes a Material Action.
• Emergency authority does not expand approval limits beyond this Schedule.

entries.label: Schedule C — Delegation & Approval Matrix
entries.text: For purposes of this Schedule, approval authority is limited to the following roles:

• Executive Director (or equivalent senior executive)
• Designated Finance Officer
• Role-Scoped Staff Lead (as documented in role charter)

entries.label: Schedule C — Delegation & Approval Matrix
entries.text:
Up to \$1,000 & Role-Scoped Staff Lead & Budgeted; logged \\

\$5,001 -- \$25,000 & Finance Officer + Executive Director & Budgeted; logged \\

entries.label: Schedule C — Delegation & Approval Matrix

entries.label: Schedule C — Delegation & Approval Matrix
entries.text: No contract may be executed without documented conflict-of-interest screening.

entries.label: Schedule C — Delegation & Approval Matrix
entries.text: The following actions always constitute Material Actions and require Governing Body approval:

entries.label: Schedule C — Delegation & Approval Matrix

entries.label: Schedule C — Delegation & Approval Matrix
entries.text: Any sale, lease, encumbrance, or disposal of assets with a fair market value exceeding \$5,000 requires Governing Body approval.

entries.label: Schedule C — Delegation & Approval Matrix

entries.label: Schedule C — Delegation & Approval Matrix
entries.text: Emergency actions may be approved only within the scope defined in Schedule B.

entries.label: Schedule C — Delegation & Approval Matrix
entries.text:

entries.label: Schedule C — Delegation & Approval Matrix
entries.text: Any emergency action exceeding these limits constitutes a Violation.

entries.label: Schedule C — Delegation & Approval Matrix

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text: This Policy defines the minimum technical and procedural requirements for logging, record integrity, auditability, and retention across all systems governed by the New Doggerland governance framework.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text: No action requiring logging under the Consolidated Governance Document may occur unless it can be logged in compliance with this Policy.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text:
• all Recorded Decision Pathways,
• all Material Actions,
• all emergency actions,
• all governance votes and approvals,
• any action explicitly required to be logged by policy or schedule.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text: All governed log entries must include, at minimum:

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text:
• a unique entry identifier,
• timestamp (UTC),
• actor identity and role,
• authority relied upon,
• action description,
• affected scope objects (if any),
• linkage to related entries.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text: The Primary Logging System must satisfy all of the following:

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text:
• append-only write model,
• immutable historical entries,
• cryptographic or checksum-based integrity verification,
• role-based access control,
• read access for authorized reviewers,
• export capability for audit.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text: No user may delete or overwrite a primary log entry.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text: Corrections to logged information must be made only by:

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text:
• creating a new log entry,
• referencing the original entry identifier,
• stating the correction and reason.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text: The original entry must remain intact and visible.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text: If the Primary Logging System is unavailable, actions may proceed only where explicitly permitted by policy.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text:
• an offline log stub must be created immediately,
• the stub must be physically or digitally tamper-evident,
• the stub must be ingested into the Primary Logging System within 72 hours of restored capability.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text: Where an Operational Manual specifies a shorter or longer ingestion window, the window defined in this Schedule controls.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text: Failure to ingest an offline stub constitutes a violation.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text: A logging mechanism is considered tamper-evident only if:

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text:
• alterations are detectable,
• access is restricted and logged,
• integrity verification can be independently validated.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text: Procedures or systems that rely on trust alone do not satisfy this requirement.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text:
• both execute and approve the same logged action,
• both administer the logging system and authorize actions logged therein.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text: Access rights must be reviewed at least annually and upon role change.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text: All logs must be retained for a minimum of seven years unless a longer period is required by law or policy.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text:
• regular automated backups,
• off-site or logically isolated storage,
• periodic restoration testing.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text:
• access read-only log exports,
• verify integrity checks,
• trace Recorded Decision Pathways end-to-end.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text: Obstruction of audit access constitutes a governance violation.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text: This Policy must be interpreted narrowly. Where ambiguity exists, interpretation must favor:

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text:
• greater auditability,
• non-reversibility of log history,
• escalation rather than omission.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text: This Policy may be amended only through an Extraordinary Process as defined in the Consolidated Governance Document.

entries.label: Schedule D — Logging & Audit Integrity Policy
entries.text: All amendments must be recorded, versioned, and published alongside prior versions.
